import React, { useState } from 'react' import Alert from 'react-bootstrap/Alert'; import Button from 'react-bootstrap/Button'; import Form from 'react-bootstrap/Form'; import Modal from 'react-bootstrap/Modal'; function Search({ showSearchModal, setSearchModuleFromChild }) { const [inputs, setInputs] = useState({ tags: "", sort: "pop", releaseType: "all", depth: "1" }) const [helpMsg, setHelpMsg] = useState('') const handleInput = (e) => { const keyName = e.target.name const keyVal = e.target.value setInputs(prev => ({...prev, [keyName]: keyVal})) } const sendSearchQuery = () => { let queryOk = true if (inputs.tags.length == 0) { setHelpMsg('Provide one or more music genre.') queryOk = false } if (Number(inputs.depth) < 1 || Number(inputs.depth) > 10) { setHelpMsg('Depth needs to be between 1 and 10.') queryOk = false } if (queryOk == true) { setHelpMsg('') fetch("http://localhost:5000/scrap", { method: 'POST', headers: {'Content-Type': 'application/json'}, mode: 'cors', body: JSON.stringify({"searchquery": inputs}) }) } } return ( {setSearchModuleFromChild(false)}}> New search
{/* HELP MSG */} {(helpMsg.length > 0) ? (

{helpMsg}

 ): ( null )} {/* GENRE */} Genres You can specify one or more genres by separating them with a comma. TODO: Is it inner join? {/* DEPTH */} Depth Determines the number of fetched albums. 1 = 20, 2 = 40 *snif* and so on. {/* SORT */} Sort Some help text about it. {/* TYPE */} Release type Some help text about it.
) } export default Search
